title: Pharo ACM
description: DeFi/Crypto/Catalyst/Cardanoはメインストリームではないので、新しい人を暗号市場に乗せるのは難しい。

f6_assessments.q0:
No detail in the proposal and only asking for $1. Is this just marketing to draw attention to current projects?
This proposer has proposed or co-proposed a number of other project with little details and/or funding requests such as:
dRisk - $5
Proof of Insurance - no details
communitybond.io Integrate- no details
Community Bond -Loyalty Rewards - no details
Community Bond - Metadata - no details
Trade Finance and Credit Insurance - minimal details
Liquid Labor - Freelancer Contracts - minimal details
Endangered Language Preservation - no details
Locating Culture - no details
NAGchi - no details
NAGchi Cares - no details
f6_assessments.q1: No plan is presented and one a token $1 is asked for. It would appear this was submitted as either a placeholder or just as advertising for Pharo's other projects.
f6_assessments.q2: No plan, timeline or deliverables have been submitted thus it is not possible to audit and measure success of this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
Claiming that DeFi/Crypto/Cardano is not mainstream is a broad and vague statement, several projects in different niches and challenges could claim the same.

The solution is also not conclusive.

The idea of ​​an insurance protocol is interesting and some dapps have shown success in this niche, such as Nexus Mutual on Ethereum, but Nexus Mutual has gained popularity and relevance by providing coverage for events such as bugs/vulnerabilities in smart contracts. Pharo's proposal lacks specificity.

The premise and relevance of AMM(ACM) is that they are good models for matching liquidity. What is the argument justifying that there is a demand for high liquidity in insurance?

Who is the target audience? The proposal uses hurricane forecasting as an example event using dapp, but are there any other potential use cases?

There is no detailed plan, goals or metrics to assess the impact of the challenge.

I recommend:

Greater clarity in problem and solution description.
Rationale that establishes the reason for choosing the ACM model and case uses
Greater clarity on how this will be developed at Cardano
Detailed plan as set out in Catalyst documentation.
f6_assessments.q1:
It is not clear what the team's capacity to develop and implement this proposal is, even because the proposal itself is not clear enough.

Some links are broken and this made a full evaluation difficult.

broken https://www.pharo.tech/
broken https://docs.pharo.tech/

There is little information about the team's qualification. There is mention of 20+ years in the insurance area and 5+ years in blockchain(vague), but there are few details about the experience itself.

There are some repositories indicating the team's experience in developing Solidity, Js, CSS, but there is no information about the team's expertise in developing smart contracts in Haskell or Plutus, nor technical information about the implementation of the project at Cardano.

The requested budget is only USD 1, so I'm guessing the proposal wasn't completed on time.

The absence of a plan, lack of a reasonable budget, and the lack of clarity in the proposal make me disagree with the feasibility of this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal requires more auditability information and greater clarity on the problem it intends to solve, as well as on the solution to be provided.

There is no reasonable plan, no roadmap, no KPIs, no metrics, the budget is only asking for USD 1 and the information about the qualification of the team is not clear. Does the team have experience in Haskell or Plutus? Are you participating in the Plutus Pioneer testnet?

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal does not address how it will encourage defi development over the next 6 months. Rather it goes over info on an AMM that they are claiming is theirs and they want funding for? This proposal is unclear and does not provide the proper info to assess correctly.
f6_assessments.q1: No supporting material for experience or any relevant accomplishments for the team. This proposer has flooded catalyst with subpar proposals, and many of which are very similar if not identical. Contradicting claims have been maid throughout their proposals, and none of them provide any real plans or any real supporting material. This does not give confidence that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: We can not sufficiently audit this proposal. This proposer has flooded catalyst with subpar proposals, and many of which are very similar if not identical. Contradicting claims have been maid throughout their proposals, and none of them provide any real plans or any real supporting material.

solution: Pharoは、オートカバーメーカーを利用して、購入者が費用を保護したり、クラウドソースによる流動性や収益の創出を可能にしています。
experience: ファンド5で提出しました。ポリゴンとイーサリアムのスマートコントラクトはテストネットに入っています。保険業界20年以上、ブロックチェーン業界5年以上
